intro: Acmena championii, commonly known as the African cherry or African sour plum, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree produces small, round fruits that turn from green to yellow or red when ripe, containing several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
